primaryHost/about:
My hubby and I have been married for 38 years and have lived on this property for 37.  I work a full-time job and enjoy photography especially birds, wildlife, old barns and scenery. 

My husband does metal roofing and enjoys hunting and fishing.
sectionedDescription/access: The whole place and creek to explore at your own risk.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our "Cozy Cabin" getaway is located in a peaceful country setting. A creek & hillside is located behind the cabin (146 acres). Relax on our 2 porches and  enjoy the view of our field with horses grazing and deer passing thru. We have added a fire pit, picnic table, & gas grill for your outside enjoyment. 
All the amenities for a relaxing stay close to Yatesville Lake (18 miles), Rush Off-Road Park (13 miles) & Giovanni's Pizza (5 miles). Tristate area KY/WV/OH can be in all within 30 minutes.

The Cozy Cabin is fairly new, built just for your stay! We have an open kitchen/living room area set up to prepare and enjoy meals or just relax by the free standing gas fireplace. 
We also have cable tv and high speed internet.
A queen bedroom on the first floor and a huge upstairs bedroom with a king and 2 twin beds along with a sitting area and plenty of storage in the walk-in closet.
A fire pit has been added for a relaxing evening around the fire.

The whole place and creek to explore at your own risk.

We live next door but not too close.

This is a country setting with wildlife and few neighbors. Great place to relax and unwind.
Very romantic !
All you need to bring is your food, we have the rest covered.
Dishes, pots n pans,towels, bedding, all provided.
Everything will be clean and fresh when you arrive.

The Cabin is about 18 miles from Tri-State Airport in Kenova, WV.
12 miles from Louisa KY.
15 miles to Catlettsburg or Kenova WV or  20 miles to Huntington WV.
Close to interstate 64 ! You can be in Kentucky, Ohio or West Virginia within 20-30 minutes.

The woods are full of wildlife and the hills are steep. There is plenty of parking in front but if you need extra parking for trailers please let us know.  There is another property close for rentals if you have a large group! Just ask!

name: Welcome to the Dollhouse! Pet-Friendly.
primaryHost/about: My passion is providing my guests an escape with all the comforts of home.
sectionedDescription/access:
There is on-street parking directly in front of the house. There is room for two vehicles, if required. 
Keyless entry into the home via key code that I will provide prior to checking in.
sectionedDescription/description:
This cute and cozy bungalow is close to everything! Nestled in a quiet and safe neighborhood, we are just a few minutes away from Cabell Huntington Hospital, Marshall University,  Ritter Park, and downtown Huntington. We offer clean, comfortable, and convenient lodging and happy to host your furry family members as well. Fenced in backyard and a pet station with some pet supplies are available if needed. No pet deposits or pet fees required, at this time!

Look forward to resting in large comfortable beds. TVs are in the living room and the main bedroom offering Hulu Live TV with Disney Plus and ESPN. The Dollhouse has a very well-equipped kitchen and coffee station with snacks.

There is on-street parking directly in front of the house. There is room for two vehicles, if required. 
Keyless entry into the home via key code that I will provide prior to checking in.

We probably won't interact in person, but I can be there for you if needed.

name: Welcoming place for Hatfield & McCoy Trail Riders.
photos/0/caption: If you prefer a firmer bed, this room is for you.
primaryHost/about: Live in Florida when not in WV. Dog owner of 1 Terrier named Leo.
sectionedDescription/access: Concrete pavement for parking your vehicle. There is no public transportation so you will need a private vehicle to get around. Your smartphone's GPS won't work in the general area. Nearest restaurants and shops are about 15 minutes away. This hideaway is in the general area of the Hatfield and McCoy Trails.
sectionedDescription/description:
Cozy country home with large wrap around porch. Wake up sit and swing on front porch while having your morning coffee. Enjoy the sound of the creek flowing by house. Free Wi-Fi, cable and smart TV for all your streaming needs. Turn on the Wi-Fi calling feature on your cell phone while at a cellphone coverage area to make and receive calls during your stay. Close to outlaw trails at Hell Creek, 4 miles from Delbarton and Buffalo Trail heads.

Clean, friendly and safe. I have 2 rooms on here so if both rooms are booked you may have to share public spaces. However, you will have your own room and bath. Access to washer and dryer, as well as kitchen for long-staying guests. Please no sleeping on living room furniture

Concrete pavement for parking your vehicle. There is no public transportation so you will need a private vehicle to get around. Your smartphone's GPS won't work in the general area. Nearest restaurants and shops are about 15 minutes away. This hideaway is in the general area of the Hatfield and McCoy Trails.

I like to give guests their privacy but available if needed. Sometimes I may be out of town and my Aunt will be available next door if needed

This is a quiet and remote area. Restaurants and shops are about 15min away.

You will need a car no public transportation. Your smartphone's GPS won't work so follow these directions.

Directions:

Coming from Charleston side (North) on US-119, make a left on WV-65 towards Delbarton. Drive for about 3 miles until you see a 2-storey log house with blue tin roof on the left. Make a left at the bridge on Pearl Hill Rd. Drive straight, don't take the road over the railroad. Make a left on State St. You'll end at the red gate where the house is. 

Coming from Williamson/ side (South) on US-119, make a right instead and follow the same direction from WV-65 to Delbarton.

Coming from Delbarton on WV-65, drive until you pass the Coal Mines on the right.  About 1/4 mile, you will see a 2-storey log house with blue tin roof on the right. Turn right at the bridge on Pearl Hill Rd. Drive straight, don't take the road over the railroad. Make a left on State St. You'll end at the red gate where the house is.

If you turn it on please turn off when leaving.

name: Spacious 3 bedroom cabin with hot tub
photos/47/caption: Lots of parking! Parking pad is well over 100’ and 25’ wide.
photos/49/caption: Full view of parking area. There is roughly 15’ unpaved area (closest to you) for trailer parking if needed. Also plenty of grass to pull up if you need to turn around with a trailer.
sectionedDescription/access: There is plenty of parking on the premises, Probably 6-8 cars could comfortably park at the cabin itself on the flat parking pad. Any additional vehicles could park in the driveway itself. The driveway was just paved with asphalt, so any vehicle can access the cabin. GPS will get you to the cabin and also help navigate to any attractions you want to see/do! There is a keypad lock for self check in and check out.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located in Paintsville, Kentucky.  Gather around the wood fireplace and enjoy a game of pool. There are 2 smart tv's to  binge your favorite shows on. Or unplug and and take in the sights on the wrap around porch with a good book. Enjoy the outdoor kitchen and firepit, then hop  in the 8-person hot tub. located just 5 minutes from hiking trails, Paintsville lake state park and golf course, and local eateries . Walmart is conveniently only 8 minutes away.

This cabin is 3000 square feet, and has plenty of room to spread out. the porch has several rocking chairs, a porch swing and an outdoor dining table and chairs. There is a fire pit outside, near the out door kitchen and sectional. There is a large hot tub, with Bluetooth speakers and lights. The porch has lighting and fans for evening comfort and plenty of seating. The property is secluded on 15 acres, with a view of the mountains. There is a custom pool table also in the living room. There are 4 couches and a recliner in the house.  The master bathroom has heated floors, and a custom walk-in shower with body jets and a bench seat. There are 2 bathtub/shower combos great for small children. Washer and dryer on site in case any laundry needs to be done while on vacation. Complementary soap and shampoos are provided.

There is plenty of parking on the premises, Probably 6-8 cars could comfortably park at the cabin itself on the flat parking pad. Any additional vehicles could park in the driveway itself. The driveway was just paved with asphalt, so any vehicle can access the cabin. GPS will get you to the cabin and also help navigate to any attractions you want to see/do! There is a keypad lock for self check in and check out.

There is a paved road right up to the driveway, so getting around is a breeze. The gps can get you to any attractions you may want to visit!

There are some neighbors a few hundred yards away, so please be mindful of that in the late evenings to not make too much noise outside. 
Guests are encouraged to bring sandals for getting to and from the hot tub, so it stays clean and usable for other guests. Also if hiking is something you want to do, don't forget to bring a backpack!
sectionedDescription/name: Spacious 3 bedroom cabin with hot tub

additionalHouseRules:
1. No parties or events may be held at the Loft or on the property. 
2. No overnight guests other than those registered and approved when making the reservation online. If you are expecting visitors for a short period of time during your stay, please let your hosts know.
3. No pets are permitted without prior permission and with an additional pet charge of $25 per pet (maximum one large dog or two small dogs). Sorry, no cats are permitted ever. We have four (friendly) dogs so we will need to coordinate yard usage to avoid any possible problems. Please clean up after your pet! Pets may not be left unattended for more than 2 hours and must be in a kennel/travel carrier. If you need assistance finding a dog-sitter please contact your hosts ahead of time.
4. Trash cans and bags are provided in the Loft (under the sink in the kitchen and bathroom). If the cans get full during your stay, please take the trash out and put in one of the trash cans in, or by, the driveway. No need to take out the trash at the end of your stay.
5. No hair dying or coloring is permitted in the Loft.
6. We do not have child safety features; children are welcome if you accept liability and are comfortable knowing we have no child proofing along with many stairs.
7. Minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied, in person AT ALL TIMES, by an adult over 21. You must be 21 to book a reservation at the Loft.
8. The antler hooks by the door will not hold heavy loads. Please only hang light jackets and clothing on them.
9. Please clean your boots/shoes as well as you can before entering the building and use the boot tray upstairs by the door for your boots and shoes.
10. Please do not block neighbor’s driveways, including the apartment’s next door. We will do what we can to help you with parking (including our driveway and street parking in front of our house). Please let us know if you’re traveling with a trailer so we can help you plan for parking.
11. If you would like to sit outside, you are welcome to use the camp chairs at the bottom of the stairs. If it is raining or too sunny, feel free to sit under the carport by the house. If we are parked there, just send us a message during daytime hours (9 a.m. to 9 p.m.) and we’ll move our car: we want you to enjoy your stay! You can also sit in the backyard but be aware that our dogs will occasionally need to be let out. If you are using the yard and/or grill, we will check with you before letting out the dogs. When sitting outside after 9 p.m. please try to keep the noise down so as not to disturb the residents and neighbors.
12. Do not go out on the roof. While it looks like a great place to hang out, it’s not safe for people and walking on the shingles are likely to cause damage.
13. Without exception, no smoking, vaping or marijuana usage inside the Loft. Please don’t think it can be covered up, it cannot. We have to extensively clean to remove the contaminant before other guests can arrive. Neutralizing this contaminant inside requires a $100 minimum service fee. Feel free to step outside in the back yard and quietly enjoy a tobacco smoke or vape; you'll just need to police your butts.
14. Before you leave, please wash any dishes that you used. Clean dishes can be left in the drainer to dry and we’ll put them away.
15. No need to strip the bed or pile up used towels and washcloths upon departure but during your stay, please hang wet towels and washcloths on the towel racks, shower curtain rod or side of the bathtub.
16. Please lock the door at the bottom of the steps whenever you leave the premises, including your departure.

name: Foggy Mountain Loft near Hatfield & McCoy Trails
photos/0/caption: Newly remodeled space is comfortable and welcoming.
photos/1/caption: Foggy Mountain Loft is an "L" shaped studio apartment, newly remodeled with added features to make your stay comfortable.
photos/2/caption: A small refrigerator/freezer (with bottled water waiting for you). The couch folds down to a small bed, if you're traveling with a third person.
photos/3/caption: If you forget your teddy, you can use ours; he's waiting in the room for you!
photos/4/caption: A comfortable full-size bed awaits you!
photos/5/caption: There's a Roku TV for you to log in to your favorite app to enjoy your down time. It will rotate so you can watch from bed or the couch.
photos/6/caption: A comfortable place for two to eat, and the table expands to add a folding chair if you have a third.
photos/7/caption: A microwave, coffee maker, water heater and toaster are available for your use.
photos/8/caption: A few snacks will be available to hold you over until meal time!
photos/9/caption: A full-size tub/shower is part of the full bathroom.
photos/10/caption: We'll have a few essentials available if you forget anything.
photos/11/caption: You'll find a place to hang your jacket and park your boots in the corner as you enter. There is central heating and a window air conditioner to keep you comfortable.
photos/12/caption: Write a note home or make a list of what to do on your trip (but leave the pen for the next guest!).
photos/13/caption: A fenced-in yard for your dog to play in
photos/14/caption: A fenced-in yard for your dog to play in
photos/15/caption: Easy entry through the gate by the garage
photos/16/caption: You'll know you're there when you see the welcome sign!
photos/17/caption: You'll enter through this door, around the corner from the "Welcome" sign.
photos/18/caption: There are several steps up to the loft, which is above our detached garage.
photos/19/caption: Many mornings you'll see the foggy mountain from the loft
primaryHost/about: I'm a retired Army chaplain who likes to travel and is now offering our guest house behind our retirement home for you to enjoy.
sectionedDescription/access: Foggy Mountain Loft is on a residential street near town with free on-street parking. If you're towing a trailer, we'll try to save the spaces in front of the house for you with prior arrangement or you can use our driveway. You'll have a private entrance to the Loft at the end of the driveway with access through a digital keypad deadbolt lock.
sectionedDescription/description:
Great place near Hatfield & McCoy trailheads! The Foggy Mountain Loft has the feel of a mountain hideaway but in town, close to where you want to play & eat. There's a private entrance to this simple guest loft above the garage behind our home. You'll find a basic kitchenette, full bathroom, Roku TV and WiFi. At over 50 years old, the Loft shows its age with multiple layers of paint and years of cosmetic repairs, but it has been recently renovated to create a safe, clean & comfortable space.

The Foggy Mountain Loft is a single L-shaped room which has a double bed, futon couch, and a full bathroom with bathtub and shower. You can use our Adirondack chairs to spend time outside or stay in and watch your streaming apps on the Roku TV. There isn't a stove or oven in the Loft but there is a microwave, coffee maker, hot water kettle, toaster, air fryer and electric skillet for simple food preparation, and a grill in the garage you can use upon request.  There are also many great restaurants in Logan just a few minutes away.

Foggy Mountain Loft is on a residential street near town with free on-street parking. If you're towing a trailer, we'll try to save the spaces in front of the house for you with prior arrangement or you can use our driveway. You'll have a private entrance to the Loft at the end of the driveway with access through a digital keypad deadbolt lock.

We're available during your stay for assistance or to answer questions but you'll have as much privacy as you're looking for.

There are many places to eat in Logan and a lot of things to do:

Chief Logan State Park: 5.6 miles
Chief Logan Recreation Center: 8.2 miles
Dunks Body Shop (Gym): 12.5 miles
H & M Bearwallow Trail connector: 1 mile
H & M Bearwallow Trailhead: 4.1 miles
H & M Rockhouse Trailhead: 13.8 miles
H & M Buffalo Mountain Trailhead: 28 miles
H & M Devil Anse Trailhead: 34.6 miles

Gas station (which usually has the cheapest gas in Logan) is just about a mile away (just past the coffee house and bakery...)!

On street parking is easy to find near Foggy Mountain Loft. If you're raveling with a trailer you'll be able to find a spot within a couple blocks of the Loft. With prior arrangement, guests traveling with a trailer can have the parking spaces in front of  our house saved by us until their arrival or can park in the driveway (pulling truck into carport, there's room for a trailer with one ATV).

This is a 2nd floor loft with a narrow staircase, so you'll need to keep an eye on small children and keep in mind your own ability to climb stairs.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
1. No parties or events may be held at the Loft or on the property. 
2. No overnight guests other than those registered and approved when making the reservation online. If you are expecting visitors for a short period of time during your stay, please let your hosts know.
3. No pets are permitted without prior permission and with an additional pet charge of $25 per pet (maximum one large dog or two small dogs). Sorry, no cats are permitted ever. We have four (friendly) dogs so we will need to coordinate yard usage to avoid any possible problems. Please clean up after your pet! Pets may not be left unattended for more than 2 hours and must be in a kennel/travel carrier. If you need assistance finding a dog-sitter please contact your hosts ahead of time.
4. Trash cans and bags are provided in the Loft (under the sink in the kitchen and bathroom). If the cans get full during your stay, please take the trash out and put in one of the trash cans in, or by, the driveway. No need to take out the trash at the end of your stay.
5. No hair dying or coloring is permitted in the Loft.
6. We do not have child safety features; children are welcome if you accept liability and are comfortable knowing we have no child proofing along with many stairs.
7. Minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied, in person AT ALL TIMES, by an adult over 21. You must be 21 to book a reservation at the Loft.
8. The antler hooks by the door will not hold heavy loads. Please only hang light jackets and clothing on them.
9. Please clean your boots/shoes as well as you can before entering the building and use the boot tray upstairs by the door for your boots and shoes.
10. Please do not block neighbor’s driveways, including the apartment’s next door. We will do what we can to help you with parking (including our driveway and street parking in front of our house). Please let us know if you’re traveling with a trailer so we can help you plan for parking.
11. If you would like to sit outside, you are welcome to use the camp chairs at the bottom of the stairs. If it is raining or too sunny, feel free to sit under the carport by the house. If we are parked there, just send us a message during daytime hours (9 a.m. to 9 p.m.) and we’ll move our car: we want you to enjoy your stay! You can also sit in the backyard but be aware that our dogs will occasionally need to be let out. If you are using the yard and/or grill, we will check with you before letting out the dogs. When sitting outside after 9 p.m. please try to keep the noise down so as not to disturb the residents and neighbors.
12. Do not go out on the roof. While it looks like a great place to hang out, it’s not safe for people and walking on the shingles are likely to cause damage.
13. Without exception, no smoking, vaping or marijuana usage inside the Loft. Please don’t think it can be covered up, it cannot. We have to extensively clean to remove the contaminant before other guests can arrive. Neutralizing this contaminant inside requires a $100 minimum service fee. Feel free to step outside in the back yard and quietly enjoy a tobacco smoke or vape; you'll just need to police your butts.
14. Before you leave, please wash any dishes that you used. Clean dishes can be left in the drainer to dry and we’ll put them away.
15. No need to strip the bed or pile up used towels and washcloths upon departure but during your stay, please hang wet towels and washcloths on the towel racks, shower curtain rod or side of the bathtub.
16. Please lock the door at the bottom of the steps whenever you leave the premises, including your departure.
sectionedDescription/interaction: We're available during your stay for assistance or to answer questions but you'll have as much privacy as you're looking for.

Enjoy the privacy of a one bedroom, one bath apartment that is dedicated solely to guest use. The sofa also makes a bed suitable for one person. 

Theres no need to hassle with keys.  All doors have a key code that will be shared upon booking.
sectionedDescription/description:
We are located in downtown Pikeville, within a very short walk to Pikeville Medical Center and UPike. Enjoy the conveniences of a full kitchen and a quiet area where you can expect a peaceful night's sleep on a quality mattress.  There is one queen bed and also a twin rollout bed. Street parking is available in front of the house only. (Please don’t park in the driveway or block it.) We have door code entry so there's no need to hassle with keys.  We have a smartTV (no cable) and free Wifi.

This apartment is clean, comfortable, and conveniently located in downtown Pikeville.

Enjoy the privacy of an entire two bedroom, one bath apartment that is dedicated solely to guest use. It’s located on the second floor above a furniture store. ***Must climb stairs***

There’s no need to hassle with keys.  All doors have a key code that will be shared upon booking.  The apartment is also secured with a locking exterior door.
sectionedDescription/description:
* If you book for 7 days or more, you will receive a 20% discount off your stay.  

If you’re in town on business, to visit family or just traveling through, this 2ND FLOOR APT is perfect for you.  Enjoy a full kitchen & onsite laundry facility.   You’ll get a good nights sleep in a quiet space, on high quality mattresses. We are conveniently located just down the street from a Food City. We have a work desk & free WIFI. We’re just a 5 minute drive from downtown Pikeville.

Family oriented or perfect for the business traveler!  This apartment is spacious, clean, and conveniently located.

There’s no need to hassle with keys.  All doors have a key code that will be shared upon booking.  The apartment is also secured with a locking exterior door.

primaryHost/about: Local who rides the Hatfield McCoy Trails and who takes great pride in clean, affordable lodging. We are working hard to promote the Hatfield McCoy Trails while helping our local economy.
sectionedDescription/access: Full Kitchen, Fire Pit, and Washer & Dryer
sectionedDescription/description:
This home was recently flipped and completely restored. It is one of the first homes in Williamson and is full of history. We cannot wait to host you. Trail riders, marathon runners, business people, or stopping by for vacation, we got you covered. The house is complete with two full baths, three bedrooms, living and dining room, kitchen, fire pit, and much more. We also offer a garage ($25 per machine per stay) to house your toys. Clean. Fun. Lodging.

Living Room, 3 Bedrooms, 2 Baths, and Plenty of Parking.

Full Kitchen, Fire Pit, and Washer & Dryer

We are usually around and always available by call or text.

Close to food, bars, and the Hatfield McCoy Trails.

You can park, unload, and ride your machine to the trails. Also, you can walk, bike, or drive.

Need anything? Just message us.

sectionedDescription/description:
Located just minutes outside Huntington city limits, this trendy 2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment is centrally located between Huntington and Barboursville locations.  Just 15 minutes to Marshall University (Joan C. Edwards Stadium and Cam Henderson Center), 20 minutes minutes to downtown Huntington (Big Sandy Arena), 15 minutes to Cabell Huntington Hospital, 10 minutes
to St. Mary's Hospital.  And 15 minutes to Huntington Mall and Barboursville Park/Soccer Complex.

While visiting the Huntington area, enjoy the comfort of this stylish 2 bedroom apartment, that includes washer and dryer and a bathroom for each bedroom. It is fully furnished with all new modern furniture and stainless steel appliances. Includes internet service and netflix.

We live in the same neighborhood so we are most always available if any questions or situations arise.

It is fully furnished with all new modern furniture and stainless steel appliances. Includes internet service and netflix.
sectionedDescription/summary:
Located just minutes outside Huntington city limits, this trendy 2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment is centrally located between Huntington and Barboursville locations.  Just 15 minutes to Marshall University (Joan C. Edwards Stadium and Cam Henderson Center), 20 minutes minutes to downtown Huntington (Big Sandy Arena), 15 minutes to Cabell Huntington Hospital, 10 minutes
to St. Mary's Hospital.  And 15 minutes to Huntington Mall and Barboursville Park/Soccer Complex.

primaryHost/about:
Rustic Ravines is the perfect getaway
Nestled in the foothills of the Allegheny Mountains, Rustic Ravines cabin rentals is West Virginia’s Ideal escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Our cabins sit on 300 acres of wooded paradise and are surrounded by 50,000 acres of private and public ATV trails, and other activities as diverse as kayaking, archery, fishing, hunting and golf. Our cabin rental facilities are ideal for events of all kinds. We’re located in Genoa, West Virginia, 27 miles south of Huntington and the Ohio River.

sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to apartment and deck only, and 2 designated parking spots.
sectionedDescription/description:
At this great location you can see barges loaded with coal/stone/etc go by on the river. The deck directly overlooks the Ohio River. This upstairs apt provides all the comforts of home including full kitchen and laundry room. Within walking distance to St. Mary's Medical Center as well as to a small park offering basketball & tennis courts, a playground and walking path. On the flat of Huntington allowing easy access by car or bike. Location is peaceful and quiet. Off street parking included.

The view of the river and all river activity is really a sight to behold.

Guests have access to apartment and deck only, and 2 designated parking spots.

Host couple, Judy and Greg, are very available and wish to support your reasonable needs during your stay.

Neighborhood is among the oldest in Huntington. Original home was built about 1900.

Public transportation comes within blocks

Host property and gardens are kept in attractive condition. 

A queen size, quality, inflatable air mattress is available on request. 

In cold weather a gas heater in the central living room area provides heat. Operation is simple and safe. Other small electric heaters are available as well.

There are 7ft ceilings throughout the apartment. Anyone taller than that might not fit!

sectionedDescription/description:
Located just five blocks from Downtown Huntington, three  blocks from Ritter Park, and only eleven blocks from Old Main at Marshall University, this charming second story studio apartment is centrally located in Huntington.  Equipped with a full kitchen, private bath and a deck of your own this studio apartment sleeps one to two guests.  It has a twin bed for individual guests and a sofa/futon for one additional guest.  TV and internet service is included.

Enjoy the tranquility of Ritter Park and the Rose Garden there.  Hike on one of the trails or play tennis on one of the public lighted tennis courts at the park, or visit the YMCA that is in very close proximity.
Downtown Huntington has many popular restaurants and retail stores and a movie theatre for your entertainment.

We live in Huntington and can usually answer any question or address any situation that comes up with a quick message on Airbnb or a phone call.

name: House on 100 Dillion St. Hatfield McCoy Trail
photos/14/caption: Rock Formation Rockhouse Trail
photos/15/caption: Worlds Longest ATV Train Trestle! You will ride this to the Rockhouse Trail System.
sectionedDescription/access: There is parking for 4 trucks and trailers (20') at the house. If trailer is larger than 20' parking is available on our property across street, under the bridge. You can also text John for more details.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located in the heart of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System

HMT Rentals has direct trail access, we are  located in downtown Man, WV, less than one mile  from the Rockhouse Trailhead of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.

Check-In to our unit, drop your trailer, unload your machines and ride your ATV, UTV or Motorcycle directly to one of the local businesses in the Town of Man. Businesses include (Gas, Food, Bar and Grill, Sporting Goods!!)

There is parking for 4 trucks and trailers (20') at the house. If trailer is larger than 20' parking is available on our property across street, under the bridge. You can also text John for more details.

Ride your machine through town to access the Hatfield McCoy Trail. Access Rockhouse Trail, Devil Anse Trail and Buffalo Mountain Trail. Also, ride your machine into town to eat at one of our many restaurants.

name: Hidden Acres: 200 acres, indoor pool/spa, trails
photos/31/caption: Please note that the shower jets and bidet do not function.
sectionedDescription/description:
A hidden gem amidst the rolling hills of Blaine, KY’s, our estate is a sanctuary of luxury and nature.

Immersed in the lush hills of Blaine, Kentucky, discover our estate - a hidden jewel wrapped in nature's grandeur. As you traverse the scenic countryside to reach us, the captivating vistas and serenity set the tone for a remarkable retreat.

Nestled amidst unparalleled tranquility, the seclusion of our haven beckons you to disconnect and enjoy the simpler pleasures. We suggest stocking up on your favorite food and beverages before arrival, given the remote location. Small local markets lie within a 5-10 minute drive, while larger facilities in Paintsville, KY, are a 30-minute journey.

An enchanting, gated driveway of nearly a mile ushers you in, winding through the verdant hills. The ascent to the 800' elevation promises an unforgettable spectacle, climaxing with the reveal of a custom-built, all-brick mansion at the final curve. (In snowy conditions, a 4 wheel drive vehicle is advisable.)

At the summit, pause and drink in the panoramic views, where time seems to stand still. It's like camping atop a mountain, with the luxury of a sprawling 6,000 sq ft estate as your 'tent'.

Upon entering, you are greeted by a welcoming foyer. The main floor encompasses a cozy bedroom, a full bathroom, a functional laundry room, a spacious living room, a well-equipped kitchen and dining room, and direct access to the pool room. Ascend to the second floor to find three beautifully appointed bedrooms, including a luxurious master suite with an en-suite bathroom, and an additional full bathroom. Intriguingly, one of the third-floor bedrooms is uniquely accessible through a second-floor bedroom. Venture to the basement, and you'll discover two additional bedrooms, a full bathroom, and an expansive game room/living space.

Our home boasts 7 inviting bedrooms and 5 full bathrooms, each designed for utmost comfort. Following adventurous days exploring the trails, the indoor heated pool and hot tub offer a perfect sanctuary to relax and rejuvenate.

The estate’s expanse includes 200 acres of scenic trails. Acquired in 2021, we're restoring neglected paths to their former glory. Traverse along high ridges, and be mindful of your surroundings as some trails lead to dead ends. Children must always be supervised.

Experience a getaway where the beauty and potential risks of nature intertwine. Here, the incredible views from the peaks are as breathtaking as the valleys are deep. Prepare for a vacation where adventure, relaxation, and unforgettable moments await you!

ANYONE WHO PLANS TO BRING ANY TYPE OF ATV OF UTV IS REQUIRED TO SIGN A WAIVER IN ORDER TO RIDE ON THE PROPERTY. Booking of this property acknowledges that the entire group staying understands this policy and the person who books is fully responsible for making sure each individual in their party is aware of the waiver and signs the waiver before riding.

RIDERS MUST REMAIN ON THE DESIGNATED TRAILS AT ALL TIMES!

*Please note: This property is able to accommodate weddings for an additional $1000.

Winter bookings: Please be advised, the driveway and the roads will not be serviced in the winter. If you are arriving during or after snowfall you will need four wheel drive.

Guests are welcome to message through the app with any questions or concerns. If you plan to check in later than 8pm please make sure to review the check in instructions as we may not be available after that time.

This location is very remote. There are local markets within 5 or 10 minutes as well as a gas station. There is a market about 7 minutes away located in Martha that has good pizza, but there is no delivery. Larger retail stores and fast food chains are located 30 minutes away in Painstville.

If you plan to visit after we get snow, make sure to bring a 4 wheel drive vehicle or you will not make it up the driveway. We typically don't get a lot of snow, but when it does come, a 4 wheel drive vehicle is a must!

Local recommendations can be found in our personally created guidebook. The guidebook can be found in the itinerary for your stay. Once you've accessed the itinerary, scroll down to "where you'll be" and click on “show more”. The next screen will have a link to the guidebook. You can also access all of our guidebooks on our host page.

We kindly mention that we require guests to have at least one positive review to reserve a stay. We implement this policy to ensure the safety and respect of our home. The booking guests must also be at least 25 years old.

Please note our extra guest policy: For over 16 guests there's a fee of $35 per person, per day, to account for added liability, wear, tear, and cleaning. The fee is applicable for the number over guests exceeding 16. We allow up to 20 guests.


The bidet seen in the master bathroom is not operational. Please do not turn on the water to this feature.

While the hot tub is an attractive amenity, unexpected repairs can occasionally happen. For this reason we cannot guarantee the hot tub 100% of the time.

We strictly prohibit the organization of parties or similar events at our property. This policy is integral to ensuring the comfort, security, and satisfaction of all our guests, as well as the maintenance and preservation of our property and the peace of the surrounding community.

name: Audree's Coal River Place (2426)
p3SummaryAddress: Saint Albans, West Virginia, United States
photos/11/caption: Wonderful bed with a mattress that is the perfect blend between firm and comfortable.
primaryHost/about: Bill joined the AirB&B family in 2018 when his daughter thought he might enjoy listing one of his furnished apartments for short-term rental. The two of them had so much fun setting up the space for travelers that he has kept it going. Bill loves traveling and has been to various points around the USA, but nothing compares to his time spent in Uganda, East Africa (though he still claims West Virginia beats all!). He and his wife Cecilia have been married for over 50 years and have three grown children. His oldest daughter Angela rents her Farm House and Barn Loft on Airbnb, his youngest daughter Cara works as a nurse at CAMC, and his son Keith has been a missionary in Uganda. He has 18 grandchildren and0 he welcomes you to visit his Coal River Hideaways!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
You have access to the entire apartment. Queen size bed and full size futon in bedroom.We want you to know that we’re doing our part to
help our Airbnb guests stay safe by cleaning and
disinfecting frequently touched surfaces (light
switches, doorknobs, cabinet handles, remotes, etc.)
before you check in.
sectionedDescription/description:
Coal River Hideaway has every thing you need for work or play. This fully furnished apartment is close to the metro Charleston area plus conveniently located near Coal River for kayaking. Guests have access to clean towels, a full kitchen,  wireless internet, TV, and washer and dryer. So if its for an extended stay with work, visiting family in the St. Albans area, or looking for a launching place for site-seeing the beautiful state of West Virginia, this is a very affordable place to stay.

This is a great place to consider for long term work assignments or other long term stays. In the bedroom is a Queen size bed and futon for sleeping (Air B and B describes it as a couch/bed but its a futon). There is a one time $35 cleaning fee so if multiple nights are booked the cleaning fee is still $35. Please no pets. Mr. McFarland has a strict no pet policy.

You have access to the entire apartment. Queen size bed and full size futon in bedroom.We want you to know that we’re doing our part to
help our Airbnb guests stay safe by cleaning and
disinfecting frequently touched surfaces (light
switches, doorknobs, cabinet handles, remotes, etc.)
before you check in.

A lock box will be provided to access the apartment.  Depending on the length of stay-the guest may or may not interact with the owner.

This apparment is located on Shadyside  Road right before you have the choice to go through the tunnel to River Bend. Sunday Stables, and the Coal River Group, or the choice to go up the hill to Lower Falls, or the choice to turn right into River Lake Estates.

There is no public transportation available.

Down the street to the right a fishing lake, play ground, and pretty neighborhood roads are available for walking, running, or biking. A Dollar Store is available for purchasing pantry items and other necessities.

primaryHost/about: A lifetime resident of W.Va. with a passion for travel and tourism. I Absolutely LOVE to meet new people, EXPERIENCE different cultures, taste the many different cuisines, and hike.
sectionedDescription/access:
Shared front and back deck area, charcoal grill, picnic table and fire pit. 
THERE IS NO ACCESS INSIDE THE GARAGE AT THIS TIME
sectionedDescription/description:
Nestled in the beautiful Appalachian Mountains, a great place for outdoor enthusiasts and adventure seekers. Whether you enjoy riding the Hatfield-McCoy Trails or engage in hiking, fishing or kayaking you will love the convenience of our location to all your adventures. This unit offers a full kitchen with basic necessities, a spacious living room, two bedrooms, a full bathroom with basic amenities, charcoal grill, picnic table, firepit, and plenty of parking for ATVs and trailers.

Unit B Furnished and stocked with the basic necessities. The bedrooms come with clean linen, pillows and blankets. The bathroom has towels, toilet paper, soap, shampoo and conditioner. The kitchen is furnished with a microwave, 1 cup-Keurig, toaster, complete assortment of dishware, cooking utensils and appliances. Fully heated and air conditioned inside with a nest thermostat.
Plenty of parking for ATVs & Trailers.

Shared front and back deck area, charcoal grill, picnic table and fire pit. 
THERE IS NO ACCESS INSIDE THE GARAGE AT THIS TIME

primaryHost/about: I've had rental property for 20 years.  I'm a residential building and remodeling contractor, family man, dad to three grown children and  grandpa to 3 little girls under the age of 4.  I'm preparing and looking forward to retirement and will be spending my time on my hobbies of buiding and refinishing furniture and searching for antiques.

sectionedDescription/description:
COZY, QUAINT, AND MINUTES FROM DOWNTOWN.  

This is a newly remodeled three bedroom home.  Very spacious with off street parking.  All wood floors and nicely tiled shower.  Two queen size beds in bedroom one and two.  Bedroom three is vacant.  Large eat in kitchen, washer and dryer, side and front entrance.  Small private back yard.

Everything is new and fresh!!  Very clean!

I live about 10 minutes from the property and am available for any needs you have.  If free, I will meet you at check-in but self check-in is also available.  Lock box will be available at side entrance.

sectionedDescription/access: There will be one closet near the dining table that will be locked and not for guest use.
sectionedDescription/description:
Kick back and relax in this calm, stylish space.

This apartment is newly remodeled. I tried to go with the modern farm house style. The apartment is located on a hill with easy parking. The apartment is on the first floor. Each bedroom has a small closet and dresser.

There will be one closet near the dining table that will be locked and not for guest use.

If your stay is during the summer you might hear the lawn mower or the weed eater. You may also hear an occasional train.

Free easy parking in front of the apartment.

I have a no pet policy including service dogs because I have allergies. I am the one who cleans the apartment. I love animals but I am the one who cleans the apartment.I take prescribed allergy  medicines daily and monthly allergy shots. 

This apartment is in a great location for healthcare professionals or anyone traveling to nearby towns such as  ……..

. Prestonsburg 15 min. drive
. Martin 5 min. drive
. Pikeville 20-25 min. drive
. Paintsville 20-25 min. drive

I have had several long term guest working at Pikeville Medical, Prestonsburg ARH, and McDowell ARH.

sectionedDescription/summary: Kick back and relax in this calm, stylish space.
sectionedDescription/transit: Free easy parking in front of the apartment.

additionalHouseRules:
1.  Quiet time starts at 11 PM until 8 AM each day.

2.  Please do not move any of the furniture or home decor unless you feel like something may get damaged or stained, an example would be table cloth or runner.

3.  Please do not take any items from the home including home decor, towels, sheets,  linens , candles, throws, cleaning supplies tissue paper and or paper towels.

4. There is no smoking allowed in the Airbnb. You may smoke outside, however please do not throw the cigarette butts in the yard or landscaping.

5. Upon leaving the Airbnb please make sure all lighting is turned off, including outside lighting, and the air conditioning is turned up to 74 and or the heat down to 65.

6.  Upon leaving the Airbnb please make sure all the dirty dishes are in the dishwasher and the towels washcloths and hand towels placed in the washing machine with the washer door left open.

7.  The Jacuzzi tub jets always need to be pushed in a downward direction otherwise water will be squirting all over the bathroom. There is one master control on the right corner, a button that you push down. This button also turns the Jets off.
To the left of that button is a set of buttons that creates therapeutic bubbling for a spa like experience.
After the Jacuzzi tub is turned off at some period of time you will hear it kick on Making a loud noise,and this is the Jacuzzi tub clearing the jets of water it is completely normal.
Please do not put any types of bath oil,  bubble bath , bath salts etc. or anything in the Jacuzzi tub as this will cause damage. 
If by accident excessive water get on the floor or tub surround area, there are extra old towels and Linens to clean the water up underneath the dryer drawer.

8.  Please do not put any feminine hygiene products in the toilets and or baby wipes or adult wipes 
as this will clog up the plumbing system.

9.  Please do not use the decorative pillows, and pillow shams to sleep on.

10.  If a service animal  is accommodating you during your stay please do not allow the animal on the furniture or bedding or the nice decorative throws that are throughout the house and or apartment. We love animals but it is extremely expensive to clean pet hair from upholstered fabrics and linens.

11.  We ask that you be conservative with the utilities such as electric and water. We do not want any of our guest to be Uncomfortable with heating, cooling, and water usage. Being conservative with the utilities keeps the cost of the Airbnb rental down.
Please leave the heating and air-conditioning unit on auto. Please do not switch this to fan. 

12.  The mattresses and pillows are new and are Nectar brand which is similar to Tempur-pedic. We let our guest know this in case they prefer a different kind of pillow. We do have a variety of pillows.

13.  The house  includes a front loader washer and dryer. Please clean the lint filter on the dryer after each use  and before you leave as this can be a fire hazard. Please leave the washer door open upon leaving or when not using as this will cut down on mildew and mold smell in the washer.

14.  NO PETS

15.  NO MINORS are to be left on this property without adult supervision!

sectionedDescription/access: Guest have access to the entire property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Bring the whole family to this great place with lots of room for fun. 
The huge front porch provides the perfect place for morning coffee or evening drinks. 
The backyard patio with portable fire pit is a great place to gather and look at the stars. 
The spacious sunken family room with fireplace provides the perfect ambience for any occasion. The master suite with a huge whirlpool tub creates a Spa like atmosphere. 
The kitchen includes stainless steel appliances and solid cherry cabinetry.

The Guests will be sent an access code for the keypad the day of arrival. 
When guests pull in the driveway you will be facing the Red back door in which guests will enter to access the house. Upon entering through that door guests will be in the sunroom then walk to the landing, the sunken family room is to the left the step up kitchen is straightahead with a hallway that leads to bedrooms and bathrooms. The master suite is to the left in the hallway. The dining room is left of the kitchen. You can access the large front porch through the dining room. 
Guests should know that the decor is changed seasonally and updated and the grounds are being worked on at this time.
The beds are nectar brand and are like a Tempur-pedic bed and super comfortable. A Keurig coffee pot is available for our guest and we provide a couple of days of coffee and creamer, Bottled water along with hand soap, hand sanitizer paper towels and Kleenex.

Guest have access to the entire property.

I will be available to offer help throughout your stay. I try to keep my phone with me as much as possible and you are welcome to text or call me if you need questions answered.

The AirBnb is located in Quaint Court in the mountains of Appalachia. 
The home of the famous country music star Loretta Lynn is just a few miles from this property. 
The Spill Way/ Park / Dewey Dam/ Jenny Wiley State Resort Park is just minutes away from this property. 
The Paintsville Lake is also just a few minutes from this property. 
The town of Paintsville is about 4-5 miles away. 
This is a safe neighborhood and I have owned this home for about 20 years. 
It is very peaceful and quiet.

We offer local tours by Tuscany Tours. Hourly fees apply. Please inquire.

There is no smoking in the house but you can smoke on the front porch. 
I am very particular about cleanliness and have the home professionally cleaned between guest.
The landscaping is being re-worked for winter and Spring. Fountains and pond are being prepared for Spring.

primaryHost/about: Local who rides the Hatfield McCoy Trails and who takes great pride in clean, affordable lodging. We are working hard to promote the Hatfield McCoy Trails while helping our local economy.

sectionedDescription/description:
3 bedroom suite with private living and dining room. We are located in downtown Williamson, WV and within 0.5 miles of the entrance to the Hatfield McCoy Trails. 2 full bathrooms and plenty of parking. Join us for first class accommodations for trail riders, marathon runners, business trips, or vacation. We also offer a detached garage that will hold up to 4 SXS or ATVs for $25 per machine per stay.

3 bedroom, 2 bath, fully furnished suite. Kitchen, living room, and dining room also included. Lots of secured parking too.

Garage for storage (additional fee of $25/machine per stay)
Close to restaurants and bars.

Assistance is available via phone or text.

Close to the mall, food, shopping, and the Hatfield McCoy Trails. We are also a price location for anyone attending the Hatfield McCoy Marathon or for all your business trips.

Park, Unload, and Ride Your Machine or Walk to the Hatfield McCoy Trailhead that is 1/2 mile away.

One of the best places to stay as voted by the local newspaper.

name: Rush RV Camper  Experience an Rv before buying one
photos/22/caption: View of entrance from the street, driveway is big enough for a truck and trailer
primaryHost/about: Passionate about meeting new guests and ensure they create new good memories while being their host , to know about their different cultures and create long lasting relationships. As a Realtor and Business consultant my purpose is to help grow my clients financially
sectionedDescription/access: The guest will be given an access code to get the key , it is an Rv so there a three step metal stairs
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to Rush , a rural community with charms, where you can relax and have a quiet country stay this Rv is located in a quiet  residential  area with great neighbors . We provide all amenities for your stay , full kitchen 
The Rv is located 3 miles away from Rush of Road park that can be access with your sport vehicle 
 On a special note the cell phone coverage is not the best
Get around should be by car,  or sports vehicles like an ATV  . Be respectful of traffic laws and the locals

The is an RV Camper is located in a residential area , on a super safe area 
it has sleeping capacity for 4 people comfortably, it has a king size bed and two bunk beds. We provide all the amenities , linen and towels , shower gel , shampoo and conditioner. You can cook like you are at home because we provide a full kitchen set up , plates , bowl’s , utensils, cups , gasses , pans and pots. Paper
The stove is gas and operates on propane 
The Fridge , water heater and furnace operates with propane 
We have a Keurig Mini coffee machine with coffee provided 
It has a small 32 inch smart TV with Netflix, Disney plus , and Ruko 
We offer wifi internet 
Our guest have a picnic table and a charcoal barbecue but charcoal is not provided

The guest will be given an access code to get the key , it is an Rv so there a three step metal stairs

Guest can contact me any time through the reservation portal

The neighborhoodis quietand save , is the great Rural Life
No loud Music
No Events
No Rv rideon the Property 
No parkingin the grass

The guest need a car to get around, ATV is not a problem as long as the rules are respectful and respect the traffic laws and the respect the neighbors

The internet is slow , the cell phone service is not the best depending on the carrier 
If you have never been in an Rv camper you need to let me know to send you instructions for some people might find it challenging , it is a use camper and in the winter you might see condensation in the windows and moist 
Important not for the winter is that there is a surge charge or $25 for each propane refill ,  because in the winter to heat up the camper at 70 degrees it takes 1 propane tank every two days

photos/5/caption: Cabin has 30 amp RV hook up. This is for cabin guest family and or friends only and is $30 per night. Sorry no dump station yet.
photos/6/caption:
This is us. 
Greatest woman in the world. This place couldn’t operate without her.
photos/9/caption: We keep it hot year round.
photos/21/caption: Beautiful sunsets.
photos/22/caption: Morning fog is amazing!!!!
primaryHost/about: My name is Johnny Maco Deaton III. I have spent all of my life running an electrical business and becoming burnt out on that venture of life so I’m wanting to start a cabin rental business.
sectionedDescription/description:
Drive/Fly-in to this beautiful cabin with all the modern conveniences and enjoy the most breathtaking views of East Kentucky! Walking distance(1/4 mile)from JKL Airport. Leave your worries behind you as you turn the key in this two-bedroom, one-bathroom, cabin situated far enough from the hustle and bustle of everyday life that all you hear is nature, but close enough to civilization that you can sneak into town for a bite to eat in less than ten minutes. Pic don't do this cabin justice!

You can use the whole mountain top.

I’m available by phone,text or e-mail. 
Also we live about 1-1/2 mile away so we can help you with whatever you may need.

The National Weather Service Office and a small airport is on same mountain but far enough away(about 1/2 mile) that you won’t notice it’s even there. Airport traffic very low(maybe 1 plane a week) but pilots are welcome to come stay with us. We have rental car and hanger space for your plane.

This is the Hemlock cabin. It’s the Second cabin on the right. There’s only two cabins at the moment.

additionalHouseRules:
- No smoking
- Pet friendly with a $75 fee (+ fees & taxes, max 2 dogs)
- No events, parties, or large gatherings
- Must be at least 25 years old to book
- Additional fees and taxes may apply
- Photo ID may be required upon check-in
- NOTE: The property requires 5 steps to access and may be difficult for guests with limited mobility. There is a bedroom and full bathroom on the 1st floor
- NOTE: Your safety matters. This property features 4 exterior security cameras. There is a camera located on each corner of the house, all facing out. These cameras do not look into any interior spaces. These cameras record video when activated by motion and will be on during your stay
- NOTE: This property features 2 interior motion detectors. 1 detector is located in the living room and the other is located in the kitchen. These devices only detect motion and do not record video or sound. They will be on during your stay
- NOTE: There is ongoing construction occurring at the next door property. Noise and construction workers may be present during your stay

primaryHost/about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Nestled in the historical town of Hagerhill, this 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom vacation rental is ideal for families or friends hoping to immerse themselves in nature! There are a bevy of nearby trailheads and museums including Jenny’s Creek Trailhead and the East Kentucky Science Center, both less than 6 miles away. Reconvene with your group after your fun-filled days on the patio or cozy up next to the fireplace with your furry friend - the choice is yours when you book this charming home!

4,100 Sq Ft | Pet Friendly w/ Fee | Electric Fireplace | ~ 3 Mi to Paintsville

This well-appointed house is perfect for road-trippers and adventure-seekers looking to enjoy the great outdoors!

Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: 2 Twin Beds w/ Twin Trundles | Additional Sleeping: Pack ‘N Play

MAIN FEATURES: 4 Smart TVs, 6-person dining table, high chair, office w/ desk, ceiling fans, books, board games, furnished patio, private yard
KITCHEN: Fully equipped, dishware/flatware, cooking basics, spices, drip coffee maker, teapot, blender, microwave, toaster, toaster oven, water filter, ice maker
GENERAL: Free WiFi (5G), central A/C & heating, linens/towels, iron/board, trash bags, paper towels, washer, dryer, laundry detergent, complimentary toiletries, hair dryer
FAQ: Entry steps required, 4 exterior security cameras (facing out), 2 interior motion detectors (kitchen, living room)
PARKING: Shared driveway (5 vehicles; first-come, first-served)
ADDT’L ACCOMMODATIONS: Two additional properties are available on-site, each with separate nightly rates: both are 1-bedrooms for 4 guests. If you would like to reserve multiple rentals, please inquire for more information prior to booking

Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

OPT OUTSIDE: Jenny’s Creek Trailhead (5 miles), Arrowhead Point Trailhead (6 miles), Sugarcamp Mountain Trailhead (7 miles), Paintsville Lake State Park (10 miles), Jenny Wiley State Resort Park (10 miles), Dewey Lake (10 miles), Jane Beshear Trailhead (28 miles), Breaks Interstate Park (60 miles), Creation Falls (62 miles), Red River Gorge Zipline (63 miles), Red River Gorge (64 miles), Natural Bridge State Resort Park (67 miles)
LOCAL ATTRACTIONS: East Kentucky Science Center & Planetarium (5 miles), Van Lear Historical Society (7 miles), US 23 Country Music Highway (7 miles), Mountain HomePlace (10 miles), Mountain Arts Center Studios (10 miles), Loretta Lynn Homeplace (10 miles), Camden Park (63 miles), Kentucky Reptile Zoo (65 miles)
DAY TRIPS: Lexington (120 miles), Frankfort (142 miles), Cincinnati (169 miles), Louisville (191 miles)
NEARBY: Paintsville (3 miles), Prestonburg (10 miles), Pikeville (35 miles)
AIRPORTS: Big Sandy Regional Airport (14 miles), Rogers International Airport (81 miles)

photos/21/caption: Chapmanville trail connector is 1 mile from this residence.
sectionedDescription/description:
Recently renovated, house was built in the late 1930's and is the only residence left in the commercial district of Chapmanville, Wv.  This house is excellently located right off of the Main Street (Rt.10) and the train tracks running through town.  A dozen restaurants, shopping, liquor, grocery and sight seeing are all within walking distance.  Bring your UTV or a trailer full, we can accommodate you, plenty of parking. The town is ATV/UTV friendly to trailriders.  Trail connects within miles.

Enter the home by code keypad either at the rear or front of the home.  The ADT alarm can be disarmed with the same code as used for the entrance doors.
The downstairs is a multi-area concept with 2 living rooms, a dining room, separate kitchen with more dining space, full bathroom, a hallway with french doors leading to an office/bedroom space with stairs leading to 2 sleep rooms upstairs.  The front of the home has a 10x20 porch that sits on the Main Street of Chapmanville, a patch of grass, flowers a couple small trees, yard decorations and a chain link fence separate the the porch from Main Street Rt.10 roadway.  The chain link fence surrounds the entire front and sides of the home, the rear of the house sits upon earth behind a 60' long, 6' tall retaining wall.  Below the retaining wall is 70' of gravel parking for the home, but please do not park with in 20' from the center of the railway.  We have security cameras in use around the exterior of the property and in-use where designated restricted areas, these areas are visibly marked.

The side of the home has a newly poured concrete patio with seating for 7; a 3 person bench and a full size picnic table and patio cushions located in the side house foyer, accessible through the kitchen.  A exterior wood burning fireplace and grill. Large wooden benches and other places to sit outside are located at all entrance and exit doors around the property.  

The rear of the home has an entrance for a below ground basement, this is a restricted and locked area.

Host available by telephone, text, or email. A handyman is available during the day, a plumber and electrician are available by appointment.

Small, very active and busy town

There are 9 food establishments in the Town of Chapmanville within walking distance.  There's 2 dollar type stores, 3 pharmacies, 2 florist, 1 grocery store, 2 bars and several fueling stations, all with in a short walk or a minute drive from this location.  A Veterans Memorial with mementos from WW2 is located across from Dairy Delight.

An ATV UTV repair shop is located across from the dairy delight, next door to the veterans memorial.

Liquor and alcohol sales are available at the CVS pharmacy, 2 blocks away next to Wendy’s fast food.  We have video only security cameras around the property in use.
sectionedDescription/interaction: Host available by telephone, text, or email. A handyman is available during the day, a plumber and electrician are available by appointment.
sectionedDescription/name: Main St House, Great Parking, 1 mile from trails
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Small, very active and busy town
sectionedDescription/notes: Liquor and alcohol sales are available at the CVS pharmacy, 2 blocks away next to Wendy’s fast food.  We have video only security cameras around the property in use.
sectionedDescription/space:
Enter the home by code keypad either at the rear or front of the home.  The ADT alarm can be disarmed with the same code as used for the entrance doors.
The downstairs is a multi-area concept with 2 living rooms, a dining room, separate kitchen with more dining space, full bathroom, a hallway with french doors leading to an office/bedroom space with stairs leading to 2 sleep rooms upstairs.  The front of the home has a 10x20 porch that sits on the Main Street of Chapmanville, a patch of grass, flowers a couple small trees, yard decorations and a chain link fence separate the the porch from Main Street Rt.10 roadway.  The chain link fence surrounds the entire front and sides of the home, the rear of the house sits upon earth behind a 60' long, 6' tall retaining wall.  Below the retaining wall is 70' of gravel parking for the home, but please do not park with in 20' from the center of the railway.  We have security cameras in use around the exterior of the property and in-use where designated restricted areas, these areas are visibly marked.

The side of the home has a newly poured concrete patio with seating for 7; a 3 person bench and a full size picnic table and patio cushions located in the side house foyer, accessible through the kitchen.  A exterior wood burning fireplace and grill. Large wooden benches and other places to sit outside are located at all entrance and exit doors around the property.  

The rear of the home has an entrance for a below ground basement, this is a restricted and locked area.
sectionedDescription/summary: Recently renovated, house was built in the late 1930's and is the only residence left in the commercial district of Chapmanville, Wv.  This house is excellently located right off of the Main Street (Rt.10) and the train tracks running through town.  A dozen restaurants, shopping, liquor, grocery and sight seeing are all within walking distance.  Bring your UTV or a trailer full, we can accommodate you, plenty of parking. The town is ATV/UTV friendly to trailriders.  Trail connects within miles.

An ATV UTV repair shop is located across from the dairy delight, next door to the veterans memorial.

sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to their own private driveway. The front driveway is all yours, no need to worry about anyone blocking you in, for I park around back in the garage. Guests have access to the entire first level, as well as the second floor kitchen.
sectionedDescription/description:
Nestled in the Irish neighborhood of Valley View Dr. 
This unique airbnb looks and feels like home..  Newly renovated and on the first floor,  this guest suite has it's own private entrance, washer dryer, full bathroom, access to full kitchen, 60" flat screen, Apple TV,and WIFI.   Just minutes from downtown Ashland and only a few miles to Hunington, WV. You will love the quiet flavor of the neighborhood.  It's a perfect location for travelers who are enjoying all the Tri-State Area has to offer.

Located off Interstate 64 off the Catlettsburg exit. The home is only 2 miles from King’s daughters hospital and Central Park, as well as downtown Ashland. 3 miles from Ohio, 5 miles from Marathon Petroleum Company, and 15 miles from Huntington, WV.

Guests have access to their own private driveway. The front driveway is all yours, no need to worry about anyone blocking you in, for I park around back in the garage. Guests have access to the entire first level, as well as the second floor kitchen.

I am very accessible and easy to get ahold of, whether by text, call, email, or through Airbnb.

The neighborhood is located in a nice and quiet part of town near a dead end street, so traffic and noise is kept at a minimum.

My house is located in the heart of Ashland.  It far from all the things Ashland offers, and not far from the interstate and highways. Besides being in Kentucky, you can get to Ohio or West Virginia with ease.

Guests will have access to their own full bathroom, access to a fully furnished kitchen, two leather coaches, washer and dryer, closet space for luggage and clothing, a table/work space, and a queen bed.

primaryHost/about: Bill joined the AirB&B family in 2018 when his daughter thought he might enjoy listing one of his furnished apartments for short-term rental. The two of them had so much fun setting up the space for travelers that he has kept it going. Bill loves traveling and has been to various points around the USA, but nothing compares to his time spent in Uganda, East Africa (though he still claims West Virginia beats all!). He and his wife Cecilia have been married for over 50 years and have three grown children. His oldest daughter Angela rents her Farm House and Barn Loft on Airbnb, his youngest daughter Cara works as a nurse at CAMC, and his son Keith has been a missionary in Uganda. He has 18 grandchildren and0 he welcomes you to visit his Coal River Hideaways!

sectionedDescription/description:
Coal River Hideaway Upstairs is a fully-furnished apartment that is conveniently located 16 miles from Charleston and very near to the beautiful Coal River! Guests have access to a full kitchen, clean towels, TV & wireless internet, and a washer and dryer. So whether you are a traveling nurse, have an extended stay with work, are visiting family in the area, or are simply site-seeing around the beautiful state of West Virginia, this is a very safe, relaxing, and affordable place to stay.

We want you to know that we’re doing our part to
help our Airbnb guests stay safe by cleaning and
disinfecting frequently touched surfaces (light
switches, doorknobs, cabinet handles, remotes, etc.)
before you check in.

name: Matewan Riders Retreat New Remodel , Garage , Cozy
sectionedDescription/access:
We have parking in the front and back of the property and across the street .
We own the post office and lot beside of it where you can park . If parking across street please park In front of the empty lot parallel to the street .
sectionedDescription/description:
Looking to ride the trails , escape into the hills with us. We are Located one mile from the Historic town of Matewan , also known as the Battle of Matewan and the Matewan Massacre. Devil Anse trail 21 trailhead is located directly in front of the town . Outlaw trails are in our backyard,cross the bridge in matewan and you can access these trails .Newly remodeled and  detached Garage for SXS or ATV parking . Enjoy the Best Pizza in all of West Virginia located around the corner and they deliver!

We have two queen beds and two twin beds. We also have futons available with extra pillows and comforters. We have one full bath , and one half bath . 
Two seperate TV spaces , with access to your favorite shows and movies .
Enclosed Porch for all your riding gear ! 
Grill and Fire Pit for outdoor entertainment .

We have parking in the front and back of the property and across the street .
We own the post office and lot beside of it where you can park . If parking across street please park In front of the empty lot parallel to the street .

sectionedDescription/description:
This newly renovated house is located just minutes between the very popular Hatfield McCoy Trail heads for Buffalo Mountain and Devil Anse. The Dollar General grocery store is also located within 1 mile for all of your grocery needs.  This entire house offers 3 bedrooms with 5 beds, full kitchen, living room, washer and dryer, bathroom, fire pit, ping pong table, outdoor grill, and free parking with room for a large trailer.  Additional amenities include WiFi, TV, and a spacious backyard.

You will love staying at our property!  There is plenty of parking on both sides of the house.

We are almost always available by phone or text to help our guests.  We also live right across the street and we live right across the street from the house.  We love interacting with our guests!

Murphy Branch is a wonderful neighborhood.  We have a Dollar General Store approximately 1/2 mile up the road.

Our town is ATV friendly as long as helmets are worn.  There is parking on both sides of the house.

name: Modern Spacious 4BR Apartment in Downtown Ashland
sectionedDescription/description:
The Jewel Airbnb is a 4 bedroom 1 bath downtown Ashland apartment above The Jewel Art Gallery, 2nd floor apartment- stairs required. It is centrally located behind Fat Patty’s, & Pour House Coffee, less than 2 blocks from the Paramount Arts Center, & across the street from several eateries. Walking distance (.8 miles) from King’s Daughter’s Hospital. We a have a washer & dryer, dishwasher, & toaster oven for your convenience. We can discount further for monthly stays!!!

Downtown Ashland, centrally located & fun to enjoy!

Street parking which is normally available right in front of the building.

We clean linens on the hottest setting using Buff City Soap “Fresh Cotton”. Everything is wiped down with Clorox and we use vinegar & hot water in the bissel crosswave to clean the floors. 

Most all of the art is available for purchase using Ven mo, but is meant to be enjoyed. They were all created by local artists.

primaryHost/about: Jodina and I live in central Indiana. We enjoy traveling to new places and sharing those experiences with our kids.
sectionedDescription/access: Full access to the entire home and it’s property with exception of cleaners closet.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is "Not Just Another Trail House”.   This fully remodeled home is designed for riders that want more than a bunkhouse and prefer a more intimate setting like being in your own home.  This home is less than a half mile to the Devil Anse trail head and 1 mile from downtown Matewan. Fix your meals in the stocked kitchen or on the Blackstone Griddle, or eat at one of Matewan's restaurants! This home is designed for a maximum  6 guests. Please request host approval for anything different.

3 bedrooms - 4 beds
2 bathrooms
Kitchen, living, dining, and laundry rooms
Large parking area for 3 vehicles with trailers.

Full access to the entire home and it’s property with exception of cleaners closet.

We make every effort to be available for questions via the app and by text message.

This area of Matewan is known as “Hatfield Bottom”

No need to trailer, ride your SXS everywhere!

Parking notes;  Updated to reflect the new gravel parking area. If you have 3 trailers we recommend 2 of them being under 20' depending on tow vehicle length. If you have multiple longer Rigs or just want more space, there is also public parking for trucks/trailers in town. This would allow for parking longer rigs and just driving your SXS / ORV to the house.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Our home is designed for a maximum of 6 guests. If you have more than this please contact us to see if we are able to host you. 
Quiet hours after 11pm out of respect for the neighbors.

name: Hill’s Hideaway~ by “Porchswing Properties”
photos/0/caption: Beautiful Rolling CliffTop and Hill’s wrap around you as you enjoy this charming Cottage.
primaryHost/about:
Host:
    Debbie Copas Hill was born and raised in Menifee County, KY and currently resides in Michigan with her husband and 2 children. For most of her life, Debbie has been a caretaker of some sort. From working with patients, to owning a daycare, or taking care of her family at home, she knows how to make you feel comfortable and at home. Enjoy your stay and we hope you make many fond memories while you are here!
sectionedDescription/access:
Full Cottage with private yard and drive.
Soak in the Hot Tub overlooking the beautiful wooded area. Relax on the deck enjoying the coziness of the Deck Fireplace.
sectionedDescription/description:
Kick back and relax in this calm, stylish space. Complete with Hot Tub, Outdoor Fireplace , BBQ Grill, Lawn games, Kayaks for rent “For our Guest Only”  
What’s not to love about this beautiful cozy cottage made for two. 
 ((((NO CHILDREN ALLOWED!))))
Great place to Relax and celebrate your special getaway. Enjoy relaxing in the Hot Tub as you listen to nature. This is a Romantic, Beautiful place for any special occasion and at any time of the year!
Ask Debbie about the “ROMANCE PACKAGE”

Relax in this charming cottage. Soak away your troubles, aches and pains, plan a romantic getaway. enjoy relaxing in the hot tub overlooking heavenly views. Complete Serenity!

Full Cottage with private yard and drive.
Soak in the Hot Tub overlooking the beautiful wooded area. Relax on the deck enjoying the coziness of the Deck Fireplace.

Available by text/call

The cottage is located only three miles from the beautiful Cave Run Lake! Where you can enjoy fishing, swimming, kayaking and many trails near by inside “The Daniel Boone National Forest”

You’re surrounded by nature. No neighbors but one “My Momma, and my Brother and Sister in Law and they are the ones that watch over everything for me. 
The area is surrounded by beautiful hemlocks, pines and wildlife. Some days you can sit on the deck and hear the running of the waterfall and creek. Such a beautiful area. Quite and Serene.
My mom has chickens for Organic eggs “Available For Our Guest Upon Request” So from time to time you’ll hear the clucking of hens and the occasional crow from a rooster. Our guest truly enjoy them and they usually want fresh organic eggs to enjoy while they are here…some even take more home with them.

Roads to the beautiful Cave Run Lake and surrounding areas are in very good condition.
The driveway to the cottage is very nice. Brand new property with a huge wide  gravel driveway. 
The neighborhood is of beautiful rolling cliff tops, rolling hills with nicely paved roads.

Firewood for firepit available at only $5. Bundle.
Kayaks available for only $25. That’s for both of them for the entirety of your stay.

sectionedDescription/description:
Located just five blocks from Downtown Huntington, three blocks from Ritter Park, eleven blocks from old Main at Marshall University and 1 mile from Cabell Huntington Hospital this cozy  second story 1 bedroom apartment is centrally located in Huntington.  Furnished with leather recliner loveseat with cowhide throw, cowhide chair and bedroom barn door, this uniquely decorated one bedroom has a full kitchen with eat in bar, private bath and outdoor sitting area in the courtyard.

Enjoy the tranquility of Ritter Park and the Rose Garden there.  Hike on one of the trails or play tennis on one of the lighted public tennis courts.  And  visit the YMCA that is a matter of minutes away.
Downtown Huntington has many popular restaurants and retail stores and also a movie theater for your  entertainment.

sectionedDescription/description:
Hello, River 2 Ridge Outfitters is a newly remodeled 3 BR, 2 Bath house. We can accommodate up to 12 people in beds. Full kitchen, LR, dining room, washer/dryer, garage mud room, fire pit, SXS wash station, covered storage, and free WiFi.  Perfect location in southern WV to ride/hike the beautiful mountains. We are approximately 1.5 miles from trails that link with HM Trail system (Buffalo Mtn)accessible from lodge, so you don’t have to trailer machines.Any questions contact us at 304-784-1719.

8 miles from Williamson, WV 
With several restaurants in the area.

We are available 24/7 for our guests

additionalHouseRules:
Please:
Take your shoes off at the door.
Enjoy a cold Ale-8 (in the fridge) and a snack (located by the Keurig).
Relax, unplug and enjoy the natural beauty.
Make yourself at home.
Take care when in the yard. The moss ground covering has been a 20 year labor of love.
Enjoy a small fire in the pit with the provided wood and fire starter. 
Get a good night's rest.
No smoking in the house and do not put butts on the ground. There is an ashtray on the front porch.
Put all used sheets, towels, wash cloths, dish rags, etc. in the bathtub before checking out.
Wash, dry and put away dishes where they came from. 
Let us know if you need anything. We strive to make your stay stress free and welcoming!
